item.title:
The bananas we all know cannot reproduce. They are in fact a hybrid of two other plant species with no seeds. They can only reproduce with the aid of farmers, who remove and transplant part of the plant's stem in order to create new bananas
[read more: https://t.co/i0A4cmmZiq] https://t.co/92UyzGCBLi

item.title:
Today marks the 8th anniversary of the public launch of FAIR-Paris.
The Parisian site of FAIR (Meta's Fundamental AI Research organization) is one of 7 sites and one of the largest.
*Amazing* research has come out of FAIR-Paris over the years.
FAIR-Paris hosts around 30‚Ä¶ https://t.co/LS6O3fTwTL

item.title: Did you know that in order to transmit DNA to our descendants, our DNA strings get shuffled? This involves breaking and repairing the DNA. The "Broken Genome" project tries to better understand this process. https://t.co/EAiVNAFoAv

item.title:
Canaries were used in mines in the 1800s to detect gases, such as carbon monoxide, being the birds much more sensitive than humans to small amounts of the gas
This device was used to resuscitate them when they showed signs of poisoning
[read more: https://t.co/GUr16mDVTq] https://t.co/jLpcc6g2nv
